name: B. Young Photographer
statement:
Among other things, Bob is keen on photography. Especially he likes to
take pictures of sportsmen. That was the reason why he placed himself in
position of a long straight racetrack and got ready to take pictures.
But the problem was that not all the runners passed him. The total
amount of sportsmen, training at that racetrack, equals . And each of
them regularly runs distances within a particular segment of the
racetrack, which is the same for each sportsman. For example, the first
sportsman runs from position to position , the second from to What is
the minimum distance that Bob should move to have a chance to take
pictures of each sportsman? Bob can take a picture of a sportsman, if he
stands within the segment that this sportsman covers on the racetrack.
